001package io.jstach.ezkv.dotenv;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.InputStream;
005import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
006import java.util.regex.Matcher;
007import java.util.regex.Pattern;
008
009import org.jspecify.annotations.Nullable;
010
011import io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesMedia;
012
013/**
014 * Dotenv (<code>.env</code>) format based on
015 * <a href="https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv">Node JS dotenv</a> library. A couple of
016 * difference between other implementations:
017 * <ul>
018 * <li>Interpolation is done by EZKV and not an external bash process (or not at all in
019 * the case of dotenv-java).</li>
020 * <li>No decryption is available like the newer dotenvx</li>
021 * <li>Tab and newline (both cr and ln) escaping is allowed but not other escape
022 * sequences</li>
023 * <li>EZKV makes no assumption where the env files is or if it is just called
024 * <code>.env</code></li>
025 * </ul>
026 * The extension is {@value #FILE_EXT} and thus a resource named <code>.env</code> will
027 * match this media.
028 * <p>
029 *
030 * <strong>It is highly recommended to load environment variables</strong> with
031 * {@link io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesLoader.Builder#variables(java.util.function.Function)}
032 * and
033 * {@link io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.Variables#ofSystemEnv(io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesEnvironment)}
034 * for compatibility but is not required.
035 * <p>
036 * Note that there is no formatter for this media at this time as formatting dotenv is
037 * unclear.
038 *
039 * <h2>Example</h2>
040 * {@snippet :
041 * var kvs = KeyValuesSystem.defaults()  // The service loader will pick up this format
042 *      .loader()
043 *      .variables(Variables::ofSystemEnv)   // Env variables for interpolation
044 *      .add("./.env")                       // Load dot env file (take note of file name)
045 *      .load();
046 * }
047 *
048 * If you do not wish to use the Service Loader you can add an instance of this class to
049 * {@link io.jstach.ezkv.kvs.KeyValuesSystem.Builder}.
050 *
051 * @apiNote This is not included with the core ezkv module because dotenv is still
052 * evolving and likely to keep changing.
053 */
054public final class DotEnvKeyValuesMedia implements KeyValuesMedia, KeyValuesMedia.Parser {
055
056        /**
057         * For service loader.
058         */
059        public DotEnvKeyValuesMedia() {
060        }
061
062        /*
063         * This regex was adapted/inspired from https://github.com/motdotla/dotenv
064         */
065        private static final Pattern LINE = Pattern.compile(
066                        "(?:^|^)\\s*(?:export\\s+)?([\\w.-]+)(?:\\s*=\\s*?|:\\s+?)(\\s*'(?:\\\\'|[^'])*'|\\s*\"(?:\\\\\"|[^\"])*\"|\\s*`(?:\\\\`|[^`])*`|[^#\\r\\n]+)?\\s*(?:#.*)?(?:$|$)",
067                        Pattern.MULTILINE);
068
069        /**
070         * Dotenv file extension.
071         */
072        public static final String FILE_EXT = "env";
073
074        /**
075         * Dotenv media type does not really exist so we use a custom one of
076         * {@value #MEDIA_TYPE}.
077         */
078        public static final String MEDIA_TYPE = "application/x-env";
079
080        /**
081         * Dotenv media type does not really exist so we use a custom one of
082         * {@value #MEDIA_TYPE}.
083         * @return {@value #MEDIA_TYPE}.
084         */
085        @Override
086        public String getMediaType() {
087                return MEDIA_TYPE;
088        }
089
090        /**
091         * Returns dotenv file extension.
092         * @return {@value #FILE_EXT}
093         */
094        @Override
095        public @Nullable String getFileExt() {
096                return FILE_EXT;
097        }
098
099        @Override
100        public Parser parser() {
101                return this;
102        }
103
104        @Override
105        public void parse(InputStream input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) throws IOException {
106                String s = KeyValuesMedia.inputStreamToString(input);
107                parse(s, consumer);
108        }
109
110        @Override
111        public void parse(String input, BiConsumer<String, String> consumer) {
112                String lines = input.replaceAll("\\r\\n?", "\n");
113
114                Matcher matcher = LINE.matcher(lines);
115
116                while (matcher.find()) {
117
118                        String key = switch (matcher.group(1)) {
119                                case String s -> s;
120                                case null -> throw new IllegalStateException();
121                        };
122
123                        // Default undefined or null to empty string
124                        String value = switch (matcher.group(2)) {
125                                case String s -> s.trim();
126                                case null -> "";
127                        };
128
129                        // Check if double quoted
130                        char maybeQuote = value.isEmpty() ? '\0' : value.charAt(0);
131
132                        // Remove surrounding quotes
133                        value = value.replaceAll("^(['\"`])(.*)\\1$", "$2");
134
135                        // Expand newlines if double quoted
136                        if (maybeQuote == '"') {
137                                value = value.replace("\\n", "\n")
138                                        .replace("\\r", "\r")
139                                        // tab expansion is in dotenvx
140                                        // as well as many others so might as well.
141                                        .replace("\\t", "\t");
142                        }
143                        consumer.accept(key, value);
144                        ;
145                }
146        }
147
148}
